Public Works Commission
Agenda Report

Public Works
Commission Meeting
08-25-21
Item
4.A.

To:

Chair Simmens and Members of the Public Works Commission

Prepared by:

Troy Spayd, Assistant Public Works Director/City Engineer

Approved by:

Rob DuBoux, Public Works Director/City Engineer

Date prepared: August 20, 2021

Meeting date: August 25, 2021

Subject:

Capital Improvement Projects and Disaster Recovery Projects Status
Report

RECOMMENDED ACTION: Receive and file report on the status of the City’s current and
upcoming Capital Improvements Projects and Disaster Recovery Projects.

DISCUSSION: Staff will provide a status update on the following active projects in the
Fiscal Year 2021-2022 Capital Improvement Program:

Capital Improvement Projects (Design)

Marie Canyon Green Streets
(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The City has recently received Measure W funds to complete this
project. Staff is working on the project plans to prepare for public
bidding.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: September 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Winter 2021

PCH Median Improvements Project

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) Consultant is working on the final design changes. In August, the City
to perform

released a request
construction management services with proposals due in September.

from consultants

for proposals

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Fall 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Winter 2021/2022

Page 1 of 6

Agenda Item # 4.A.

PCH Signal Synchronization System Improvements Project

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) Consultant submitted 95% design documents in June 2021 we have

(cid:131)

received some comments to those plans.
In August, the City released a request for proposals from consultants
to perform construction management services with proposals due in
September.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Final Design: August 2021
(cid:131) Advertise: October 2021
(cid:131) Award Contract and Begin Construction: Winter 2021

Civic Center Stormwater Diversion Structure

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) A Los Angeles County Flood Control maintenance agreement is
required for this project. Staff received the County’s approval of the
agreement.
(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Final Design: Completed. Need approved maintenance agreement to

be signed and executed.

(cid:131) Begin Construction: October 2021

Westward Beach Road Improvements Project

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The project requires coordination with Los Angeles County Beaches
and Harbor. Staff is working out the final details of the project with the
County and will be finalizing the design.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Fall 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Winter 2021

Civic Center Water Treatment Facility Phase 2

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) Project engineer is preparing the 90% design documents.
(cid:131) The City obtained a project CDP from Planning Commission on

February 1, 2021.

(cid:131) The State has approved the City’s application for the State Revolving

Fund program.

(cid:131) The project assessment engineer has continuing the process of
evaluating the project costs and calculating each parcels estimated
assessment.

(cid:131) Staff hosted the community meeting on May 27, 2021.
(cid:131) Staff has mailed letters to impacted properties with their preliminary

estimated assessments.

Page 2 of 6

Agenda Item # 4.A.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: December 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2022

Capital Improvement Projects (Construction)

Civic Center Way Improvements

(cid:190) Updates: The contractor continues to maintain the new planting material
during the establishment period per the contract documents. This period ends
at the end of August 2021. Staff will be closing out the project.

Malibu Park Drainage Improvements

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of storm drain repairs within the
Malibu Park neighborhood. These repairs are the result of damage caused
by the subsequent storms after the Woolsey Fire. Work will include clearing
and grubbing, demolition, cold milling, removal of existing corrugated metal
pipe, new asphalt berms/dikes, pavement repairs, pavement overlay, striping,
new reinforced concrete pipes, and rock slope protection.

(cid:190) Updates: Construction started at the Morning View location and included
installing a new 60" HDPE pipe and constructing a new inlet basin and
headwall. The contractor will also begin working at the other locations per the
project plans and specifications. Work will include temporary lane closures
with flaggers.

(cid:190) Project Schedule: August 2021 through October 2021

2021 Annual Street Maintenance

(cid:190) Project Description: This project provides for the reconstruction and
maintenance of City streets. Including asphalt pavement repairs, Type II
slurry seal, speed humps and new thermoplastic striping.

(cid:190) Updates: City Council awarded the contract at the July 12th meeting to
Pavement Coatings Co. City staff is currently working with the contractor on
project related submittals.

City staff is currently working with the contractor on
project related submittals.

(cid:190) Project Schedule: Begin construction the last week of August 2021 through

October 2021

Capital Improvement Projects (Not Started)

Bluffs Park Shade Structure

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of the installation of four single-post

shade structures at Malibu Bluffs Park

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Summer 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2021

Page 3 of 6

Agenda Item # 4.A.

Vehicle Protection Devices

(cid:190) Project Description: Per Malibu Municipal Code Section 17.48.070 requires
vehicle impact protection devices to be installed for all parking spaces located
adjacent to any outdoor pedestrian seating area. There are two locations
within the City’s right-of-way and City-owned property that would require a
vehicle impact protection device.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Summer 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2021

Disaster Projects (Design)

Broad Beach Road Water Quality Infrastructure Repairs (CalJPIA Project)

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The project consultant has started the design of the project.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Summer 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2021

Latigo Canyon Road Roadway/Retaining Wall Improvements (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) Staff is finalizing the design of this project.
(cid:131) Staff is also working with FEMA/CalOES to substitute the existing

timber with non-combustible materials.

(cid:190) Project Schedule

(cid:131) Complete Design: Fall 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Winter 2021

Trancas Canyon Park Planting and Irrigation Repairs (CalJPIA/FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The project consultant has started the design of this project.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Summer 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Summer/Fall 2021

Trancas Canyon Park Slope Stabilization Project (CalJPIA Project)

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The project consultant has started the design of this project.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Summer 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Summer/Fall 2021

Page 4 of 6

Agenda Item # 4.A.

Birdview Avenue Improvements (CalOES Project)

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The design of this project has been included in the Malibu Park
Drainage Improvements project and updates will be provided under
that project.

Outdoor Warning Sirens (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Updates: This project will be funded through a grant from FEMA after the
Wooley Fire. Staff received proposals from consultants to design and to
develop a plan that includes the evaluation of a siren system and possible
locations. It is anticipated a consultant will be hired in September 2021.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Unknown

Storm Drain Master Plan (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project will be funded through a grant from FEMA
after the Woolsey Fire. The City will create a complete inventory of storm
drains, culverts, debris basins, manholes, and other drainage structures
within the City. Staff released a request for qualifications/proposals from
qualified firms. Proposals are due in September 2021.

(cid:190) Updates: An RFQ was send out on August 19, 2021 seeking qualified

consultants to develop the master plan.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Completion Date: Spring 2022

Disaster Projects (Construction)
None at this time

Disaster Projects (Completed)
Guardrail Replacement Citywide (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consisted of replacing the damaged

guardrail throughout the City as a result of the Woolsey Fire.

Corral Canyon Road Bridge Repairs (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consisted of replacing fire damaged existing
fencing and repairing the damaged embankment adjacent to the bridge.

Corral Canyon Culvert Repairs (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project has been cancelled as it could not get FEMA

approval.

Disaster Projects (Not Started)
Clover Heights Storm Drain (FEMA Project)

Page 5 of 6

Agenda Item # 4.A.

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of design and construction of a few
storm drains on Clover Heights. The existing storm drain facility ends at the
intersection of Clover Heights and Harvester Road. During storms, this
intersection floods and causes debris to block the road. An extended storm
drain towards the end of Clover Heights will help eliminate this issue.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Spring 2022
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Summer 2022

Latigo Canyon Road Culvert Repairs (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of repairing the existing storm drain
on Latigo Canyon Road located approximately 2,500 feet from PCH that was
damaged by the Woolsey Fire.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Winter 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Spring 2022

Encinal Canyon Road Drainage Improvements (CalOES Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of repairing damage storm drain
facilities and roadway embankments that were damaged by the Woolsey Fire.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Winter 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Spring 2022

Malibu Road Slope Repairs (CalOES Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: The existing slope adjacent to the beach access stairs
at 24712 Malibu Road has been eroded and caused damage to Malibu Road.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Fall 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Winter 2021

Page 6 of 6

Agenda Item # 4.A.
